  by

/-- The sine of the angle between two vectors, multiplied by the
product of their norms. -/
theorem sin_angle_mul_norm_mul_norm (x y : V) :
    Real.sin (angle x y) * («expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y) =
      Real.sqrt (inner.real x x * inner.real y y - inner.real x y * inner.real x y) :=
  by
  unfold angle
  rw [real.sin_arccos, ← Real.sqrt_mul_self (mul_nonneg (norm_nonneg x) (norm_nonneg y)), ←
    Real.sqrt_mul' _ (mul_self_nonneg _), sq, Real.sqrt_mul_self (mul_nonneg (norm_nonneg x) (norm_nonneg y)),
    real_inner_self_eq_norm_mul_norm, real_inner_self_eq_norm_mul_norm]
  by_cases h : «expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y = 0
  · rw [show
        «expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» x * («expr‖ ‖» y * «expr‖ ‖» y) =
          «expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y * («expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y)
        by ring, h, MulZeroClass.mul_zero, MulZeroClass.mul_zero, zero_sub]
    cases' eq_zero_or_eq_zero_of_mul_eq_zero h with hx hy
    · rw [norm_eq_zero] at hx
      rw [hx, inner_zero_left, MulZeroClass.zero_mul, neg_zero]
    · rw [norm_eq_zero] at hy
      rw [hy, inner_zero_right, MulZeroClass.zero_mul, neg_zero]
  · field_simp [h]
    ring_nf

theorem norm_sub_eq_add_norm_iff_angle_eq_pi {x y : V} (hx : x ≠ 0) (hy : y ≠ 0) :

  exact inj_on_cos.eq_iff ⟨angle_nonneg x y, angle_le_pi x y⟩ (right_mem_Icc.2 pi_pos.le)
#align cos_eq_neg_one_iff_angle_eq_pi cos_eq_neg_one_iff_angle_eq_pi

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `inner.real -/
/-- The cosine of the angle between two vectors, multiplied by the
product of their norms. -/
theorem cos_angle_mul_norm_mul_norm (x y : V) : Real.cos (angle x y) * («expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y) = inner.real x y :=
  by
  rw [cos_angle, div_mul_cancel_of_imp]
  simp (config := { contextual := true }) [or_imp]
#align cos_angle_mul_norm_mul_norm cos_angle_mul_norm_mul_norm
cos_angle:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `inner.real -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/
/-- The cosine of the angle between two vectors. -/
theorem cos_angle (x y : V) : Real.cos (angle x y) = inner.real x y / («expr‖ ‖» x * «expr‖ ‖» y) :=
  real.cos_arccos (abs_le.mp (abs_real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_le_one x y)).1
    (abs_le.mp (abs_real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_le_one x y)).2
#align cos_angle cos_angle
continuous_at_angle:

Released under Apache 2.0 license as described in the file LICENSE.
Authors: Joseph Myers, Manuel Candales

theorem continuous_at_angle {x : V × V} (hx1 : x.1 ≠ 0) (hx2 : x.2 ≠ 0) :
    ContinuousAt (fun y : V × V => angle y.1 y.2) x :=
  real.continuous_arccos.continuous_at.comp <|
    continuous_inner.continuous_at.div
      ((continuous_norm.comp continuous_fst).mul (continuous_norm.comp continuous_snd)).continuous_at
      (by simp [hx1, hx2])
#align continuous_at_angle continuous_at_angle

theorem angle_zero_right (x : V) : angle x 0 = real.pi / 2 :=

  rw [inner_zero_right, zero_div, real.arccos_zero]
#align angle_zero_right angle_zero_right

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr‖ ‖» -/

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
theorem angle_smul_smul {c : exprℝ} (hc : c ≠ 0) (x y : V) : angle («expr • » c x) («expr • » c y) = angle x y :=
  by
  have : c * c ≠ 0 := mul_ne_zero hc hc
  rw [angle, angle, real_inner_smul_left, inner_smul_right, norm_smul, norm_smul, Real.norm_eq_abs,
    mul_mul_mul_comm _ («expr‖ ‖» x), abs_mul_abs_self, ← mul_assoc c c, mul_div_mul_left _ _ this]

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/-- The angle between a vector and a positive multiple of a vector. -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_smul_right_of_pos (x y : V) {r : exprℝ} (hr : 0 < r) : angle x («expr • » r y) = angle x y :=
  by
  unfold angle
  rw [inner_smul_right, norm_smul, Real.norm_eq_abs, abs_of_nonneg (le_of_lt hr), ← mul_assoc, mul_comm _ r, mul_assoc,
    mul_div_mul_left _ _ (ne_of_gt hr)]

/-- The angle between a vector and a negative multiple of a vector. -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_smul_right_of_neg (x y : V) {r : exprℝ} (hr : r < 0) : angle x («expr • » r y) = angle x (-y) := by
  rw [← neg_neg r, neg_smul, angle_neg_right, angle_smul_right_of_pos x y (neg_pos_of_neg hr), angle_neg_right]

theorem angle_smul_left_of_pos (x y : V) {r : exprℝ} (hr : 0 < r) : angle («expr • » r x) y = angle x y := by
  rw [angle_comm, angle_smul_right_of_pos y x hr, angle_comm]

theorem angle_self_neg_of_nonzero {x : V} (hx : x ≠ 0) : angle x (-x) = real.pi := by
  rw [angle_neg_right, angle_self hx, sub_zero]

angle_self:

/-- The angle between a nonzero vector and itself. -/
@[simp]
theorem angle_self {x : V} (hx : x ≠ 0) : angle x x = 0 :=

  rw [← real_inner_self_eq_norm_mul_norm, div_self (inner_self_ne_zero.2 hx : inner.real x x ≠ 0), real.arccos_one]

/-- The angle between two vectors is nonnegative. -/
theorem angle_nonneg (x y : V) : 0 ≤ angle x y :=
  real.arccos_nonneg _

  rw [angle_comm, angle_self_neg_of_nonzero hx]

theorem angle_neg_right (x y : V) : angle x (-y) = real.pi - angle x y :=

  rw [← real.arccos_neg, norm_neg, inner_neg_right, neg_div]

#align angle_neg_left angle_neg_left

/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
@[simp]
theorem _root_.linear_isometry.angle_map {E F : Type _} [NormedAddCommGroup E] [NormedAddCommGroup F]
    [inner_product_space (exprℝ) E] [inner_product_space (exprℝ) F] (f : «expr →ₗᵢ[ ] » E (exprℝ) F) (u v : E) :

/-- The angle between two vectors is at most π. -/
theorem angle_le_pi (x y : V) : angle x y ≤ real.pi :=
  real.arccos_le_pi _
#align angle_le_pi angle_le_pi
angle_eq_zero_iff:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/-- The angle between two vectors is zero if and only if they are
nonzero and one is a positive multiple of the other. -/
theorem angle_eq_zero_iff {x y : V} : angle x y = 0 ↔ x ≠ 0 ∧ ∃ r : exprℝ, 0 < r ∧ y = «expr • » r x :=
  by
  rw [angle, ← real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_eq_one_iff, real.arccos_eq_zero, LE.le.le_iff_eq, eq_comm]
  exact (abs_le.mp (abs_real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_le_one x y)).2
#align angle_eq_zero_iff angle_eq_zero_iff
angle_eq_pi_iff:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `«expr • » -/
/-- The angle between two vectors is π if and only if they are nonzero
and one is a negative multiple of the other. -/
theorem angle_eq_pi_iff {x y : V} : angle x y = real.pi ↔ x ≠ 0 ∧ ∃ r : exprℝ, r < 0 ∧ y = «expr • » r x :=
  by
  rw [angle, ← real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_eq_neg_one_iff, real.arccos_eq_pi, LE.le.le_iff_eq]
  exact (abs_le.mp (abs_real_inner_div_norm_mul_norm_le_one x y)).1
#align angle_eq_pi_iff angle_eq_pi_iff
angle_comm:
/-- The angle between two vectors does not depend on their order. -/
theorem angle_comm (x y : V) : angle x y = angle y x :=
  by
  unfold angle
  rw [real_inner_comm, mul_comm]
#align angle_comm angle_comm
angle_coe:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `exprℝ -/
@[simp, norm_cast]
theorem _root_.submodule.angle_coe {s : Submodule (exprℝ) V} (x y : s) : angle (x : V) (y : V) = angle x y :=
  s.subtypeₗᵢ.angle_map x y
#align submodule.angle_coe submodule.angle_coe
angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi:
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/- ./././Mathport/Syntax/Translate/Expr.lean:207:4: warning: unsupported notation `real.pi -/
/-- If the angle between two vectors is π, the angles between those
vectors and a third vector add to π. -/
theorem angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi {x y : V} (z : V) (h : angle x y = real.pi) :
    angle x z + angle y z = real.pi :=
  by
  rcases angle_eq_pi_iff.1 h with ⟨hx, ⟨r, ⟨hr, rfl⟩⟩⟩
  rw [angle_smul_left_of_neg x z hr, angle_neg_left, add_sub_cancel'_right]
#align angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi angle_add_angle_eq_pi_of_angle_eq_pi
